intro: Lathyrus odoratus var. pardalinus, commonly known as the purple sweet pea, is a variant of the sweet pea plant characterized by its striking violet and white bi-coloration. It is a climbing legume native to the Mediterranean region, featuring slender, winding stems and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. Its botanical features include compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and a robust root system that aids in nitrogen fixation. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its historical use in traditional medicine.
